meanings.definition: A diagram representing a system of connections or interrelations among two or more things.
meanings.sent1: I drew a simple graph to show how the planets are connected in our solar system.
meanings.sent2: The teacher used a graph to explain the relationship between temperature and ice cream sales.
meanings.sent3: The graph of my friendships looked like a tangled web of lines and dots.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a complex graph of thoughts, each one connected to the next.
meanings.sent5: The graph of the forest ecosystem was filled with intricate patterns of interconnections.

meanings.definition: A diagram representing a system of connections or interrelations among two or more things using points and lines.
meanings.sent1: The graph of the subway system showed how each station was connected by lines.
meanings.sent2: She used a graph to map out the relationships between characters in the novel.
meanings.sent3: The graph of the family tree resembled a tangled mess of branches and roots.
meanings.sent4: His emotions were like a graph, with highs and lows marked by points on a line.
meanings.sent5: The graph of the city's infrastructure revealed a complex network of roads and bridges.

meanings.definition: To plot or represent on a graph.
meanings.sent1: I will graph the data points to see if there is a pattern.
meanings.sent2: She decided to graph the results of the experiment to make it easier to understand.
meanings.sent3: He graphed his daily mood on a chart to track his emotional ups and downs.
meanings.sent4: The artist graphed the movement of the dancers on a large canvas.
meanings.sent5: They will graph the population growth over the past decade to analyze the trend.
